headline: JORDAN’S HIT LIST: GOP Majority Going After Garland, Mayorkas, Fauci
sentences: “When it comes to the Justice Department, Jordan said he wants to look into ‘what they’re doing to parents,’ referring to controversy over a letter comparing parent protests to domestic terrorism, which spurred Attorney General Merrick Garland to direct the FBI and other Justice Department arms to help police allege threats against school board members,” the Washington Examiner reports.

‘Jerry Nadler will never bring him in,” Jordan said, referring to the current Democratic chairman.’”
And last but not least, Jordan has set his sights on Dr. Anthony Fauci, Wuhan, and gain of function research.
According to the Examiner, Jordan says “Secretary of Homeland Security Alejandro Mayorkas has not been brought before the judiciary panel despite it having primary jurisdiction over immigration law.
Rep. Jim Jordan (R-OH), ranking member of the House Judiciary Committee, has tipped his hand on what he will do if the GOP flips the House after midterms, making Jordan chairman.

His second priority is getting accountability for the "chaos" at the U.S.-Mexico border.https://t.co/q34waB08bE
— Washington Examiner (@dcexaminer) January 21, 2022
@Jim_Jordan said he wants to look into what DOJ is "doing to parents," referring to controversy over a letter comparing parent protests to domestic terrorism.
“There are six or seven things that they misled, and there’s a bunch of other things they misled us on,” Jordan said on the podcast.

“So we need … oversight and the truth to get to the American people on that issue as well.”
.
The Ohio congressman spoke to Lisa Boothe on the podcast The Truth with Lisa Boothe.
Jordan will also investigate the “chaos” at the southern border.
